meanings.definition: A small change made to a machine or system to correct or improve its performance.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic made a quick adjustment to the engine.
meanings.sent2: She made an adjustment to the thermostat to make the room warmer.
meanings.sent3: The adjustment to the radio made it sound like a robot.
meanings.sent4: Her adjustment to the recipe turned it into a culinary masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: With a slight adjustment, the painting looked perfect on the wall.

meanings.definition: The process of adapting or changing to fit a new situation or environment.
meanings.sent1: After the move, the family needed time for adjustment.
meanings.sent2: The adjustment to the new school was challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent3: His adjustment to the cold weather involved wearing three jackets.
meanings.sent4: The adjustment to city life felt like diving into a bustling ocean.
meanings.sent5: The adjustment to the new job brought excitement and nerves.

meanings.definition: The act of making something more suitable or accurate by modifying it.
meanings.sent1: The tailor made a final adjustment to the dress before the fashion show.
meanings.sent2: She made an adjustment to the telescope to see the stars clearly.
meanings.sent3: The adjustment to the clock made time go backwards!
meanings.sent4: His adjustment to the speech transformed it into a powerful message.
meanings.sent5: With a small adjustment, the telescope revealed a hidden galaxy.
